meanings.definition: The parts of a ship's hull that extend above the waterline.
meanings.sent1: The oversides of the ship were painted a bright red color.
meanings.sent2: The oversides of the boat were damaged in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The oversides of the ship looked like giant walls rising from the sea.
meanings.sent4: The oversides of the vessel stood tall like guardians protecting the crew.
meanings.sent5: The oversides of the boat gleamed in the sunlight, reflecting off the water.
meanings.sent6: Above the waterline, the oversides of the ship were visible from afar.
meanings.sent7: The sailors painted the oversides of the ship to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent8: The oversides of the boat provided a sturdy structure for the crew to work on.
meanings.sent9: The oversides of the ship shielded the sailors from the harsh winds.
meanings.sent10: The oversides of the vessel were a striking feature against the blue ocean.

meanings.definition: To exceed the limits or boundaries of something.
meanings.sent1: She oversides her budget every month by buying unnecessary items.
meanings.sent2: If you oversides the speed limit, you might get a ticket.
meanings.sent3: He always oversides his welcome by staying too long at parties.
meanings.sent4: The excitement oversides her fear when she goes on roller coasters.
meanings.sent5: Their laughter oversides the noise of the crowded room.
meanings.sent6: The students oversides the word count for their essays to include more details.
meanings.sent7: The runner oversides his previous record by a few seconds.
meanings.sent8: The balloon oversides its capacity and burst with a loud pop.
meanings.sent9: The tree oversides the fence, reaching into the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent10: His enthusiasm oversides any obstacles in his way to success.

meanings.definition: On or to the side opposite the front or direction of movement.
meanings.sent1: The car parked oversides the building, blocking the entrance.
meanings.sent2: She placed the vase oversides on the table, away from the edge.
meanings.sent3: The dog ran oversides, chasing after a squirrel.
meanings.sent4: He leaned oversides to get a better view of the parade.
meanings.sent5: The cat jumped oversides the fence to explore the neighbor's garden.
meanings.sent6: The children sat oversides during storytime to see the pictures in the book.
meanings.sent7: The bird perched oversides on the branch, watching the surroundings.
meanings.sent8: She walked oversides to avoid the puddle on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent9: The squirrel scurried oversides, looking for a hiding spot.
meanings.sent10: He stood oversides, waiting for his friend to arrive.
